author: The Canadian Press
description: The U.S. State Department has approved the possible sale of M142 High Mobility Artillery Rocket Systems and related equipment to Canada. A news release from the Defense Security Cooperation Agency, part of the U.S. Department of Defense, estimates the cost of the sale at US$1.75 billion and says the principal contractor is Lockheed Martin. The […]
title: US Approves Sale of Mobile Artillery Rocket Systems to Canada

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Opposition leader sets benchmarks for her team as Hastie pushes harder line on migration and Coalition fights over net zero.
title: Sussan Ley Imposes KPIs on Shadow Ministers to Rein in Party Divisions

author: The Canadian Press
description: A new report that forecasts a significant lodging shortage in Vancouver next summer during the 2026 World Cup games is being used as a pitch by Airbnb for governments to loosen regulations on short-term rentals. The FIFA World Cup kicks off on June 11, 2026 and Toronto and Vancouver are the two Canadian cities hosting […]
title: World Cup Lodging Shortfall in Vancouver Predicted, Airbnb Bids to Loosen Regulations

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The Business Council of Canada (BCC) has warned in an open letter to the federal government that the next budget must tackle the issues of declining investment and growing deficits. The BCC said in its Oct. 1 letter that the country needs more public and private investment to increase productivity and boost growth, as it […]
title: Business Council Warns of ‘Investment Crisis’ in Letter to Ottawa on Budget

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Despite years of Beijing’s efforts to expand its influence in Canada, the country has yet to fully recognize or counter the threat the communist regime poses to its future, according to a former RCMP officer. Garry Clement, former national director for the RCMP’s Proceeds of Crime program, has been investigating transnational crime for decades. He […]
title: China’s Reach in Canada: Former RCMP Officer Calls for Urgent Action

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Government Shutdowns, Earthquake In Philippines, and Olive Ridley Sea Turtle Hatchlings

author: Olivia Gomm
description: A Saskatchewan judge has sentenced a former international student from India to 11 years in prison after he pled guilty to drug trafficking and possessing proceeds of crime charges. Jatinderpal Singh, 27, was an international student at an Ontario university where he finished his first year, but said he couldn’t afford to continue his second […]
title: International Student Pleads Guilty to Drug Trafficking, Sentenced to 11 Years

author: Olivia Li
description: Zambian plaintiffs alleged that the Sino-Metals Leach's toxic spill caused health problems and contaminated land and water sources.
title: Zambian Farmers Sue Chinese Mining Company Over Toxic Spill, Seek $220 Million in Damages

author: Frank Fang
description: The defendant, Guo Jian, was described by German prosecutors as a ‘multipurpose agent’ for many years.
title: Former Chinese Aide to German Lawmaker Sentenced for Spying for China

author: Matthew Horwood
description: U.S. President Donald Trump has released details on a new series of tariffs, including levies on softwood lumber that could have serious effects on Canada’s lumber industry. Trump signed a proclamation on Sept. 29 that puts 25 percent tariffs on kitchen cabinets, bathroom vanities, and upholstered furniture, building on a promise he made last week. […]
title: How Trump’s New Tariffs on Lumber Could Impact Canada

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: A Winnipeg man found guilty of arson and firing a weapon at the home of Indo-Canadian pop star AP Dhillon in British Columbia last year has received a six-year prison sentence. Abjeet Kingra, 26, was sentenced in Victoria Provincial Court to two years in prison for arson damaging a property and six years for shooting […]
title: Man Sentenced to Six Years for Shooting, Arson at Punjabi Singer’s BC Home

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith says her province will submit a formal application to the federal government’s Major Projects Office for a new bitumen pipeline to B.C.’s northwest coast. The province is committing $14 million toward early-stage planning and design for the pipeline, which it expects to submit to Ottawa by spring next year, Smith said […]
title: Alberta to Pitch New BC Coast Pipeline to Major Projects Office

author: Ryan Morgan
description: Iranian and Israeli military strikes have targeted Qatari territory this summer.
title: Trump Issues Executive Order Affirming Security Support for Qatar

author: Adam Morrow
description: The announcement comes after months of bilateral talks aimed at setting a timeline for a phased military withdrawal.
title: Pentagon Confirms Plan to Scale Down US Military Presence in Iraq

author: Andrew Moran
description: Stagflation risks in Russia persist as growth slows and inflation remains elevated.
title: Russian Manufacturing Activity Contracts for 4th Straight Month in September: S&P Global

author: Rachel Roberts
description: The Islamist group said its campaign of maritime warfare in international waters around the Red Sea was in solidarity with the Palestinians.
title: Yemen’s Houthis Claim Responsibility for Attack on Dutch Ship

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The Canadian government has denied Marineland’s request to export its remaining 30 beluga whales to a theme park in China, citing 2019 legislation that prohibits the export of living marine animals. “I want to be really clear, this is a very difficult decision to make, but it is rooted in the Fisheries Act, and I’m […]
title: Ottawa Denies Marineland’s Request to Export 30 Beluga Whales to China

author: Guy Birchall
description: The men were convicted of a total of 50 offenses, including rape, starting when their victims were just 13 years old.
title: 7-Man Grooming Gang Jailed in UK for Total of 174 Years

author: Michael Wing
description: When it reaches its peak later this month, a shower of unusually swift meteors will be observable streaking through dark and moonless skies—ideal lighting conditions for meteor spotting. The Orionids, a meteor shower named after the constellation Orion where they seem to come from but don’t, will have no moonlight to contend with when they […]
title: Super-Fast Orionid Meteors Will Fall to Earth This Month—but Where Do They Come From?

author: The Canadian Press
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney is replacing Canada’s special envoy to Europe with a “personal representative” to the European Union. John Hannaford, a former diplomat who also served as the highest-ranking official in the public service, will take up the role. His job will involve boosting trade and investment with EU countries and working to strengthen […]
title: Carney Names ‘Personal’ EU Envoy, Looks to Replace Dion as Ambassador to France

author: The Canadian Press
description: Industry Minister Mélanie Joly says Ottawa is going to be “hawkish” on competition in a bid to ease the cost of living. She says affordability is top of mind for Canadians and expanding market competition to give consumers more choices offers a path to lower prices. Joly kicked off the Competition Bureau’s annual summit in […]
title: Joly Says Ottawa Will Be ‘Hawkish’ on Competition to Restore Affordability

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Lloyd Taylor’s book, 'The Kindness of Strangers,' tells the story of his battle with Parkinson's, and the cross-country journey he took on his bike to fight it.
title: How Parkinson’s Disease and the Kindness of Strangers Changed a Toronto Man’s Outlook on Life

author: Naveen Athrappully
description: At least one person dies from cardiovascular disease every 34 seconds in the United States.
title: 1st-Time Heart Failure or Stroke Patients Display 4 Specific Signs, Study Says

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: WestJet Airlines has announced an update to its economy class seating that will see traditional reclining seats replaced with fixed-back designs. A cabin makeover on the Boeing 737-8 MAX and 737-800 aircraft operated by the Calgary-based airline will bring a new range of seating options, including “fixed recline” seats in the economy section to help […]
title: WestJet Removes Reclining Function for Economy Seats to ‘Preserve Personal Space’

author: Guy Birchall
description: European Union heads will meet in the Danish capital on Wednesday, with a meeting of the wider European Political Community slated for Thursday.
title: EU Leaders Meet in Copenhagen for Security, Ukraine Talks

author: Victoria Friedman
description: The statement followed the inaugural meeting of a South Korean–U.S. working group on visas, formed following an ICE operation at a Georgia worksite.
title: US Says South Koreans Can Work at Sites Under Existing Temporary Visas: Seoul

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Israel has said it will not permit the naval blockade to be broken or allow ships to approach an active combat zone.
title: Italian Prime Minister Urges Gaza Flotilla to Stop, Warns of Risk to Peace

author: Chris Summers
description: Bernardo Rafaelito Alejandro IV, from the Office of Civil Defense in the Philippines, said, 'We’re still in the golden hour of our search and rescue.'
title: Earthquake in Central Philippines Kills at Least 69 People

author: The Associated Press
description: SIDOARJO, Indonesia—Indonesian rescue workers were racing against the clock on Wednesday in the search for survivors from a school collapse in the province of East Java, with at least 91 students still unaccounted for, along with three confirmed dead and about 100 injured. The boarding school, which authorities said was undergoing an unauthorized expansion to […]
title: Indonesian Rescue Workers ‘Racing Against Time’ in Search for Dozens in Rubble of Collapsed School

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: People under housing stress are being 'forced into impossible choices,' a new report by the Council to Homeless Persons reveals.
title: Victoria’s Housing Crisis Deepens, Worse Outcomes Across Every Measure

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: Uncertainty surrounds reports that Beijing's state-run iron ore buyer has ordered Chinese steelmakers to stop buying ore from Australian miner BHP.
title: Chinese Iron Ore Buyer Reportedly Stops All BHP Trades, PM Calls for Quick Resolution

author: Alfred Bui
description: 'The trust issue is common across all of the complaints, and that relates to wind to solar, to batteries, to companies, to government,' said AEIC commissioner.
title: Community Distrust Casts Shadow on Australia’s Energy Transition: AEIC Commissioner

author: PA Media
description: Almost a third of workers at the Prax Lindsey oil refinery are to be made redundant after it fell into administration. The Insolvency Service said on Tuesday that 125 jobs will be cut at the site by the end of October. It will leave 255 workers at the oil refinery in North Killingholme, North Lincolnshire […]
title: 125 Jobs to Be Axed at Lindsey Oil Refinery After Administration

author: PA Media
description: GPs are considering a range of actions after voting to enter a dispute with the Government over online access plans, which they claim could put the safety of patients and staff at risk. It comes as a change, announced in February as part of the new GP contract for 2025–26, is set to come into […]
title: GPs Consider Taking Action Over Online Access Plans

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: Critics fear that the Bill fails to define the areas in which protests would be prohibited, and could lead to overreach.
title: New Zealand Considering Law to Ban Protests Near Private Homes

author: Dorothy Li
description: The U.S. State Department has identified China as one of countries engaged in state-sponsored human trafficking for the sixth consecutive year.
title: China Still Among Worst Human Trafficking Offenders, US Says

author: PA Media
description: Around 8,000 Collect+ convenience stores will be rebranded to a Royal Mail Shop after the delivery giant’s owner bought a stake in the parcel service firm. International Distribution Services (IDS) announced it had acquired a 49 percent stake in Collect+ with a £43.9 million investment. The new high street shops will sell Royal Mail postage […]
title: Thousands of Collect+ Shops to Rebrand to Royal Mail After Owner Buys Stake

author: PA Media
description: Sir Keir Starmer has said Labour will scrap the current university target and replace it with a new one for two-thirds of young people to go to university or do a “gold standard apprenticeship”. The Prime Minister told the Labour party conference that he will introduce a new target for two-thirds of people to either […]
title: Government to Scrap Target for 50 Percent of Young People to Go to University

author: PA Media
description: Tory peer Michelle Mone has accused the Government of making her and her husband a “poster couple for the PPE scandal” and claimed it had turned down multimillion-pound offers to settle a High Court legal battle with a company she is linked with. PPE Medpro, a consortium led by Baroness Mone’s husband, businessman Doug Barrowman, […]
title: Michelle Mone Accuses Government of ‘Scapegoating’ Ahead of PPE Court Ruling

author: Cindy Li, Rachel Qu
description: From assault to verbal taunting, how Falun Gong practitioners contend with ongoing CCP interference in Australia's capital.
title: Fresh Harassment Case Exposes Pattern of CCP-Linked Repression in Canberra

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Optus said the equipment did not sound an alarm when 4G stopped functioning.
title: Ericsson Equipment Malfunction Tied to Optus Dapto Tower Outage

author: PA Media
description: The UK has imposed sanctions on 71 Iranian individuals and organisations linked to Tehran’s nuclear programme amid concerns it is developing nuclear weapons. It follows a decision in August by the UK, France and Germany to revive sweeping UN-backed sanctions on Iran after efforts to restart diplomatic talks over Tehran’s nuclear programme stalled. Foreign Secretary […]
title: UK Imposes Sanctions on Iranian Firms Linked to Nuclear Programme

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: 'What it will do is allow more young people to get into home ownership,' the prime minister said.
title: 5 Percent Deposit Scheme for First Home Buyers Kicks Off

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Imperial Oil says it will cut around 20 percent of its workforce by the end of 2027 in a major restructuring. The company had 5,100 employees at the end of last year, according to regulatory filings, but has not yet said how the layoffs will impact the workforce at specific locations. Energy Minister Tim Hodgson […]
title: Calgary-Based Imperial Oil Announces It’s Cutting One-Fifth of Jobs by 2027

author: Chandra Philip
description: The Alberta government says it will offer parents with younger children $150 a week if they are impacted by a potential teachers’ strike, which the union says is “imminent.” The funds would be paid from the money saved on teachers’ salaries and training during the unpaid strike, according to the province. A majority of Alberta […]
title: Alberta to Pay Families, Provide Learning Resources If Teachers Go on Strike
